newsitem.title: USA: NFL-SAINTS RELEASE VETERAN QB JIM EVERETT.
newsitem.headline: NFL-SAINTS RELEASE VETERAN QB JIM EVERETT.

text.p: The New Orleans Saints, who last month closed a deal for Heath Shuler and drafted Heisman Trophy winner Danny Wuerffel, released veteran quarterback Jim Everett on Thursday.

The 34-year-old Everett has passed for 34,380 yards in his 11-year NFL career, including the last three seasons with New Orleans. He completed 57.5 percent of his passes for 2,797 yards with 12 touchdowns and 16 interceptions in 1996.
New Saints coach Mike Ditka acquired Shuler from the Washington Redskins in April and signed him to a four-year contract worth $7.6 million.
The 26-year-old Shuler, third overall pick in the 1994 draft, lost a battle with Gus Frerotte for the Redskins starting quarterback last summer.
The Saints also released cornerback Mark McMillian, who played just one season for New Orleans after spending four years with the Philadelphia Eagles.
